sage.networking.server

Class TCPServerSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.net.ServerSocket
      • sage.networking.server.TCPServerSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, IServerSocket

    public class TCPServerSocket
extends java.net.ServerSocket
implements IServerSocket
    A TCP implementation of a IServerSocket. This socket is able to send and receive Serializable objects from server side of a game. An underlying ServerSocket is used in this implementation.
    Author:
    Kyle Matz

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TCPServerSocket(int localPort, GameConnectionServer server)
      Creates a TCPServerSocket bound to the local port.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Overrides accept to use the ServerSocket.implAccept(Socket) instead which is used to create a TCPClientSocket.

      Creates a IClientInfo with the appropriate information for a client.

      protected boolean isRunning()

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCPServerSocket

        public TCPServerSocket(int localPort,
                       GameConnectionServer server)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a TCPServerSocket bound to the local port. The server passed in is used to process the packets received by this socket. See ServerSocket.ServerSocket(int) for information on local binding.
        Parameters:
        localPort - local port to bind to
        server - server to process packets
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
